The question is: 

The monthly average temperature in a city for the last 12 months are as follows: 

Jan: 15°C, Feb: 18°C, Mar: 20°C, Apr: 25°C, May: 30°C, Jun: 35°C, Jul: 36°C, Aug: 35°C, Sep: 32°C, Oct: 28°C, Nov: 22°C, Dec: 18°C.

Using time series analysis, forecast the temperature for the next 3 months.
message_2:
To forecast the temperature for the next 3 months using time series analysis, we can use the moving average method. In this method, we take the average of a fixed number of previous data points to predict the future values. For this problem, we will use a 3-month moving average.

First, let's calculate the moving averages for the given data:

(15 + 18 + 20) / 3 = 17.67
(18 + 20 + 25) / 3 = 21
(20 + 25 + 30) / 3 = 25
(25 + 30 + 35) / 3 = 30
(30 + 35 + 36) / 3 = 33.67
(35 + 36 + 35) / 3 = 35.33
(36 + 35 + 32) / 3 = 34.33
(35 + 32 + 28) / 3 = 31.67
(32 + 28 + 22) / 3 = 27.33
(28 + 22 + 18) / 3 = 22.67

Now, to forecast the temperature for the next 3 months (Jan, Feb, and Mar), we will use the moving averages calculated above:

January forecast: (22 + 18 + 22.67) / 3 = 20.89°C
February forecast: (18 + 22.67 + 20.89) / 3 = 20.52°C
March forecast: (22.67 + 20.89 + 20.52) / 3 = 21.36°C

So, the forecasted temperatures for the next 3 months are:

January: 20.89°C
February: 20.52°C
March: 21.36°C
